text:
Trying to get to grips with the new Julia v1.6 workflow :blush:

What does it mean for a package to fail to precompile, e.g.
```Precompiling project...
  Progress [========================================>]  1/1
  ✗ NamedDims
0 dependencies successfully precompiled in 3 seconds (4 already precompiled)
1 dependency errored```
If i get this, should i then do `using NamedDims` to see the error?

elements.text: Trying to get to grips with the new Julia v1.6 workflow
What does it mean for a package to fail to precompile, e.g.

Precompiling project...
  Progress [========================================>]  1/1
  ✗ NamedDims
0 dependencies successfully precompiled in 3 seconds (4 already precompiled)
1 dependency errored
If i get this, should i then do

text:
Yeah. The decision was made for auto-precompilation to not throw, and not show errors, just report them happening.

But `pkg> precompile` will throw and show errors & stack traces

elements.text:
Yeah. The decision was made for auto-precompilation to not throw, and not show errors, just report them happening.

But
will throw and show errors & stack traces

text:
Perhaps a message could be added like:
```To show the errors run `pkg> precompile` or try to load the erroring packages```

elements.text: Perhaps a message could be added like:
To show the errors run `pkg> precompile` or try to load the erroring packages

text: The rationale was to avoid text explosions in pkg mode with the new auto precomp process

elements.text: The rationale was to avoid text explosions in pkg mode with the new auto precomp process

text:
Yeah I think this is fine.
Just change is difficult
And a lot changed in v1.6 (and a lot of very visible changes)
